revised_title: The Classification and Permanence of Finger Patterns
tldr: This article explores the patterns formed by papillary ridges on thumbs and fingers and how they can be classified into distinct groups. It also examines the permanence of these patterns throughout a person's life and how they can be used to confirm the idea that natural selection is not the only factor in isolating plant and animal genera.
